feed.title: Mamaâ€™s Coding Dreams
feed.subtitle: A lovely wonderful blog that records my journey of coding while my baby falls asleep.

entry.title: Hundred Days Of Code - First Week

link.title: Hundred Days Of Code - First Week

entry.content:
After quitting my job from Application Scientist at Bay instrument, I become a stay-at-home mom. Although I have more time with my child, the depressed feeling comes and goes as being a full-time mom is lack of appreciation or a missing sense of accomplishment compared to what I did before as PhD and/or Scientist. So, I commit myself to take 100 Days of Code Challenge where I spend at least one hour coding for 100 days.

This is my main goals:

    1. Complete the FreeCampCode Web Certificate
    2. Have a capability to customize the design of a blog

This is the log for the first week:

    Day1:
  • Learn Basic HTML & HTML5
  • Create my Github page

Applying very basic HTML code as below in my log:

<ul>
  <li>Create bullet lists</li>
</ul>
    Day2:
  • Continue to Learn HTML & HTML5
  • Setup local work environment with Atom, GitKraken
    Day3:
  • Learn CSS style
  • Learn Jekyll blogging
    Day4:
  • Done 35% of Applied Visual Design
  • Get familiar with Jekyll blog
    Day5:
  • Completed applied visual design
  • Jekyll theme
    Day6:
  • Completed applied visual design
  • Jekyll theme with @mmistakes
  • Learn git and work jekyll blog in the local
    Day7:
  • Completed Design Principles & CSS Flexbox
  • 1/4 done with CSS Grid

Resources: Her story of completing 100DaysOfCode FreeCodeCamp Podcast of #100DaysOfCode

So, I commit myself to take 100 Days of Code Challenge where I spend at least one hour coding for 100 days. This is my main goals: 1. Complete the FreeCampCode Web Certificate 2.
